node.title: Mom reunites with first responders who helped deliver baby on plane
node.description: Castaneda Avilia was one hour into a flight from Mexico to North Carolina when her water broke.
node.content: ["A North Carolina woman has a few people in particular to be thankful for this Thanksgiving: A group of first responders who helped her deliver her baby girl onboard a Delta Air Lines plane. On Wednesday, Liliana Castaneda Avilia met with the members of the Atlanta Fire Rescue Department who helped bring her first child, Analia, into the world just weeks ago.", "Castaneda Avilia was one hour into the flight from Mexico to Raleigh, North Carolina, on November 14 when her water broke, according to the fire department. A nurse onboard helped her through contractions \u2014 telling her not to push or the baby would come out \u2014 until the plane was able to land in Atlanta three and a half hours later, Castaneda Avilia said in a\u00a0video\u00a0posted to the fire department's Facebook page, appearing to show the Wednesday reunion between the new mother and father and first responders.", "\"The airplane was coming in exceedingly fast \u2014 faster than normal,\" one first responder said at the Wednesday reunion.", "When the plane landed, fire officials boarded and found Castaneda Avilia on the floor in the back of the plane. With one push, baby Analia was born, the fire department tweeted.", "Several units were standing by as the plane landed. Once aboard the aircraft, responders found Liliana lying on the floor in the very rear of the plane. After an inspection, personnel decided to deliver the baby on the plane. After one push, Liliana gave birth to her Analia. pic.twitter.com/ynYLt7SeAl", "\"Once she did deliver, one of the flight attendants got on the microphone, and she was able to say, 'Hey, we got a baby girl,'\" the first responder said. \"It was a special occasion.\"", "\"With us as firefighters we don't deal with many happy moments,\" another first responder said at Wednesday's reunion. \"We deal with a lot of chaos and things like that. So being able to experience a moment where you have some happiness \u2014 it's definitely gratifying.\"", "Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport also\u00a0tweeted about the new arrival.\u00a0", "Meet our newest baby on board\u2708\ufe0f \u00a0On Nov. 14, Liliana began having contractions and baby began her initial descent into the world mid-flight. Once they landed, #ATLAirport\u2019s @AtlantaFireRescue helped deliver Analia. Congrats and welcome to the newest member of our ATL flight club. pic.twitter.com/LWfyXGdwBz", "Both the new mom and baby are healthy and returned to North Carolina on Wednesday after meeting with the first responders, the fire department tweeted.", "Mom and baby are healthy and expected to return home to North Carolina today. #AFRD pic.twitter.com/VtxMaInSpI", "\"Thank you to the people that were in the airplane, like the EMS, the fire department, everybody who helped us,\" Castaneda Avilia said, according to CBS affiliate WGCL-TV.", "Sophie Reardon is a News Editor at CBS News. Reach her at sophie.reardon@viacomcbs.com"]
